ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It's a useful course to learn intermediate knowledge of membrane proteins. I would recommend it as it is really informative.

I would recommend this class to a student that wanted to learn more about ion channels and their implications for human health. Having little background in cell biology, I found this course challenging.
Yes, I would recommend the course to someone that is going to be involved in the biological sciences. It is nice to understand things on a very molecular level.
I would recommend it. I especially enjoyed learning how mutations in single channels could cause diseases like cystic fibrosis etc.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course helped me to understand the importance of ion channels and other transporters. It also helped me to make the connection between disease and channels.
I hope to use what I learned in this course in my research - we'll see if I get that lucky.
